Document Sources.Sourced Statement: In a lawsuit filed Wednesday, City Attorney Barbara Parker filed a lawsuit in Alameda County Superior Court that accuses the airline of violating Oakland and California sick leave laws.
The lawsuit — filed just a couple days after Labor Day—claims that Southwest has also violated an existing settlement agreement that was supposed to resolve similar problems.
Document Sources.Source Justification: lawsuit — filed just a couple days after Labor Day

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: In 2017, the city received complaints that Southwest had a policy whereby it zeroed out unused accumulated sick leave pay on January 1 of every year, rather than carry it forward.
Document Sources.Source Justification: complaints that Southwest had a policy

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: In December 2020, the city and Southwest signed a settlement in which, among other things, the airline agreed to fully restore the sick leave hours it had canceled for certain workers between 2017 and 2020.
Document Sources.Name of Source: City of Oakland and Southwest Airlines
Document Sources.Source Justification: settlement in which, among other things, the airline agreed to fully restore the sick leave hours

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Oakland has several laws that protect workers, including Measure FF, a 2014 ordinance approved by Oakland voters that established a minimum wage and requires employers to provide paid sick leave to employees.
Document Sources.Source Justification: Measure FF, a 2014 ordinance approved by Oakland voters

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Last year, the City Council approved an ordinance to enhance and clarify the city attorney’s powers.
Document Sources.Source Justification: ordinance to enhance and clarify the city attorney’s powers

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Last year, this relatively new department ordered a Radisson Hotel in East Oakland to pay $404,491 to workers who were allegedly underpaid for nearly a year.
Document Sources.Name of Source: Oakland’s Department of Workforce Employment Standards
Document Sources.Source Justification: ordered a Radisson Hotel in East Oakland to pay $404,491 to workers

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “The City of Oakland is committed to protecting workers by ensuring that all employers in Oakland are complying with laws that protect their rights,” Parker said in a statement.

“We are grateful that the City of Oakland is holding Southwest accountable. We hope that Southwest policies and practices will finally change for good,” Eric Swygert, a Southwest employee and an elected ramp representative with the Transport Workers Union of America Local 555, said in a statement.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Southwest employee and elected ramp representative with the Transport Workers Union of America Local 555
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a Southwest employee and an elected ramp representative with the Transport Workers Union of America Local 555

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: A Southwest spokesperson told The Oaklandside that the assertion that any Oakland employee was forced to work while sick or take unpaid absences is unfounded.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: A Southwest spokesperson told The Oaklandside

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: “Southwest Airlines fully complies with applicable sick leave laws in Oakland and California, as well as with the terms of a December 2020 settlement agreement with the city,” the spokesperson said in a statement.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: the spokesperson said in a statement
